datasetClass.qaNotes: To QA this class ask Dave Falke, he is really good at it

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: The final/ dir must contain three .fasta files

datasetClass.purpose: Add an organism to the workflow. This "dataset" is not actually a dataset. Instead, it provides the framework and essential properties of the organism so that real datasets can be added to the organism. It is critical that every property of this dataset be carefully reviewed for correctness before the workflow runs this organism. Correcting them after the workflow runs is very expensive. NOTE: in the datasets file, reference strains must precede secondary strains
datasetClass.prop: The abbreviation for this organism that the end-user will see. It is used in displays when there is very limited space.
The name of this organism for use in file and directory names, for example on the download site. It should not include white space or other characters that are not file friendly.
&ncbiTaxonId; The scientific name for this entry in the NCBI Taxonomy must match the organismFullName property.

[true|false] If true then this organism is the reference strain for its species. Exactly one organism per species must set this value to 'true', and all others must set it to 'false'. FIX: NEED TO ADD VALIDATION FOR THIS TO InsertOrganism PLUGIN. The reference strain for a species has the responsibility for loading species-wide datasets, for example ESTs. Dataset classes that are intended to be used only by reference strains are typically named with the prefix 'referenceStrain-', for example 'referenceStrain-dbEST'. Be sure to include these datasets in reference strains, and omit them from other organisms.

[true|false] If true this organism acts as a representative for its taxonomic family. Some dataset classes are designed to be included only for these representatives. For example, isolates might be loaded only at the family level.
Organism abbreviation of the organism that, for this organism, acts as representative for its family. All organisms must provide this value, even if self

Only needed if this organism is a family representative. One or more NCBI taxonomy IDs that are the root IDs for this family. This is a flexible mechanism to steer around imperfections in the NCBI taxonomy at the family level.
Only needed if this organism is a family representative. The taxon name to use in download files for this family.
[true|false] If true then this organism is not included in the NCBI Taxonomy table and requires a temporary taxon id (see ncbiTaxonId). FIX: MORE HERE.
The abbreviation for this organism used by OrthoMCL-DB. FIX: MORE HERE

The name of the provider of this organism's genome data. For example, "GeneDB." This value is included in the definition lines of fasta files including the genome and feature sequences, to give credit to the provider.
The date or version number for this organism's genome, as determined by its provider. If a date, typically the date the data was downloaded. FIX: WHAT DO WE USE THIS FOR?
[true|false] If true then this genome's annotation includes predicted tRNAs. This property is read by workflow steps that predict tRNAs. If it is true those steps are skipped.
[true|false] If "true" then the ExportPred program should be run on this organism. Typically only true for Plasmodium organisms

A space delimited list of scientific names for taxa to be used to filter NRDB protein matches against this organism's genome sequence. For example: Eukaryota Apicomplexa Plasmodium. This will FIX THIS... EXPLAIN IT.
[true|false] If true then skip making orfs and skip generating download files for orfs
An approximation of the maximum intron size. Used by BLAT when mapping proteins or DNA to this organisms genome.

datasetClass.purpose: Load the primary genome sequence and annotation for an organism, when the data is provided in a GenBank format file.
datasetClass.prop: version of the data, in date format 19-NOV-12

datasetClass.purpose: Load the primary annotation data from GeneDB.

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: The final/ dir must contains two files: genome.gff and chromosomeMap.txt. The genome.gff is an output of processed GFF file. See the example dir for preprocess steps. The chromosomeMap.txt file is a tab delimited txt file with three columns: sequence ID, chromosome name, and chromosome order number. This file should be empty unless the soTerm is 'chromosome'

datasetClass.purpose: Load the complementary genome annotation data from GeneDB

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: The final/ dir must contains two files: genome.gff and chromosomeMap.txt. The genome.gff is an output of precessed GFF file. See the example dir for preprocess steps. The chromosomeMap.txt file in this dir should be empty

datasetClass.purpose: Load the non-nuclear genome annotation data from GeneDB, including mitochondrial and apicoplast.

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: The final/ dir contain one file, genome.gff. The genome.gff is an output of precessed GFF file. See the example dir for preprocess steps.

datasetClass.purpose: Load the primary annotation data in GFF3 format. And There are no unpack steps for preprocessing GFF3 files inside the dataset class. The required preprocessing steps for GFF3 files have been done in manual delivery directory.
datasetClass.prop: The source where the annotation file get from, such as GenBank, GeneDB, Broad, and etc.
The map file used to load the annotation and used in the ISF testing, such as ApiCommonData/Load/lib/xml/isf/sangerGFF2Gus.xml

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: The final/ dir must contains two files: genome.gff and chromosomeMap.txt. The genome.gff is an output of precessed GFF file. See the example dir for preprocessing steps. The chromosomeMap.txt file is a tab delimited txt file with three columns: sequence ID, chromosome name, and chromosome order number. This file should be empty unless the soTerm is 'chromosome'

datasetClass.purpose: Load the complementary genome annotation data in GFF3 format. This is a complementary class for NoPreprocess_primary_genome_features class. Same as the NoPreprocess_primary_genome_features class, there are no unpack steps for preprocessing GFF3 files inside the dataset class. All preprocessing steps for GFF3 file have been done in manual delivery directory.
datasetClass.prop: The source where the annotation file get from, such as GenBank, GeneDB, Broad, and etc.
The map file used to load the annotation and used in the ISF testing, such as ApiCommonData/Load/lib/xml/isf/sangerGFF2Gus.xml

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: The final/ dir must contains two files: genome.gff and chromosomeMap.txt. The genome.gff is an output of precessed GFF file. See the example dir for preprocessing steps. The chromosomeMap.txt file in this dir should be empty

datasetClass.purpose: Load the organelle genome annotation data in GFF3 format. Same as the NoPreprocess_primary_genome_features class, there are no unpack steps for preprocessing GFF3 files inside the dataset class. All preprocessing steps for GFF3 file have been done in manual delivery directory.
datasetClass.prop: The source where the annotation file get from, such as GenBank, GeneDB, Broad, and etc.
The map file used to load the annotation and used in the ISF testing, such as ApiCommonData/Load/lib/xml/isf/sangerGFF2Gus.xml

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: The final/ dir contain one file, genome.gff. The genome.gff is an output of precessed GFF file. See the example dir for preprocessing steps.

datasetClass.purpose: Load the primary fasta genome sequence
datasetClass.prop: Ignore this property. It should be removed from the dataset class. You can leave it blank.
version of the data, in date format 19-NOV-12

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: The primary genome data should go in this dir. The final/ dir must contain two files: genome.fasta and chromosomeMap.txt. The definition lines in the fasta file must contain the unique stable public ID for the sequence. And the public ID can be retrieved by the property sourceIdRegex. And the ID will be shown up on the website. The chromosomeMap.txt file is tab delimited with three columns: sequence ID, chromosome name, chromosome order number. This file should be empty unless the soTerm is 'chromosome'

datasetClass.purpose: Load the non-nuclear fasta genome sequence including mitochondrial and apicoplast
datasetClass.prop: Ignore this property. It should be removed from the dataset class. You can leave it blank.

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: The non-nuclear genome data including mitochondrial and apicoplast should go in this dir. The final/ dir must contain one file, genome.fasta. The definition lines in the fasta file must contain the unique stable public ID for the sequence. And the public ID can be retrieved by the property sourceIdRegex. And the ID will be shown up on the website.

datasetClass.purpose: Load the complementary fasta genome sequence
datasetClass.prop: Ignore this property. It should be removed from the dataset class. You can leave it blank.

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: A complementary genome data should go in this dir. The final/ dir must contain two files: genome.fasta and chromosomeMap.txt. The definition lines in the fasta file must contain the unique stable public ID for the sequence. And the public ID can be retrieved by the property sourceIdRegex. And the ID will be shown up on the website. This chromosomeMap.txt file should be empty here.

datasetClass.purpose: Gene features that are not provided by the annotation center
Gene features that are not provided by the annotation center

Gets the sequences from a dbEST mirror database and loads into your database instance.A less desirable alternative for dbEST ESTs is to get file(s) from NCBI dbEST in fasta format and use the class referenceStrain-ESTsFromFasta. Use these classes ONLY FOR REFERENCE STRAINS. This class does not map the ESTs to the genomes, use the class transcriptsFromReferenceStrain for each organism, including the reference strain, to map ESTs to the genome.
Gets and loads ESTs from a fasta file in manual delivery. The defline contains the EST id.
datasetClass.prop: Required. The version number or date assigned to this data.
Required. Meaningful name given to the dataset indicating the source of the data, e.g. Watanabe_EstLibrary
Required. A regular expression whose pattern matches a substring in the definition line allowing the EST id to be identified, e.g.>(\w+)
Required. Appropriate sequence ontology term_name. Consult the database, sres.sequenceontology.term_name, e.g. transcript. See http://www.sequenceontology.org/ for sequence ontology information.
Required.true or false True:Computational techniques can be used to extend and refine EST sequences and produce predictions of full length transcript sequences. False:Unembellished EST sequences.
Not required.The cloning vector (plasmid, cosmid, phage, etc) used to create the EST library.
Not required. Developmental or life cycle stage of the organism from which the cloned RNA was derived.
Not required.Name given to the library.

Not required.Brief description of the library e.g. P. falciparum 3D7 parasites were cultured either in a candle jar (XPFn, XPF2n) or in the mixed gas consisting of 3% oxygen, 5% carbon dioxide and 92% nitrogen using blood type A erythrocytes and frozen human plasma.
Not required.Name of person who provided or created the library or who can answer questions about the library
Not required.Address to use to contact above name. Often this is the institution or laboratory name. e.g. Seattle Biomedical Research Institute
Not required.Additional space for address. Often the street and city, etc. e.g. 307 Westlake Avenue N., Suite 500 Seattle, WA 98109-5219

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: The final directory should contain the single data file named ests.fasta.

datasetClass.purpose: This class gets its data from ESTs and transcripts loaded by the reference strain. It finds all of them in the database and maps them to our genome. The reference strain DOES need to include an instance of this class so that its transcripts get mapped to its genome

datasetClass.prop: Limits the number of ambiguous mappers to a max of given number, [1-30]. It is usually the largest gene family in the organism.
Data is paired end, [false|true]. Check with data provider.
Data is strand specific, [false|true]. Check with data provider.
Use CDS model for alignment, [false|true]. Use false if not sure what to use.
datasetClass.qaNotes: To begin with QA, check if symbolic links of analysisConfig.xml and a FASTQ file for each sample are created under @@dataDir@@/final. Next, go to @@websiteFilesDir@@/${projectName}/@@version@@/real/webServices/${projectName}/release-CURRENT/${organismAbbrev}/bigwig/${organismAbbrev}_${name}_rnaSeq_RSRC, get normalized bigwig files, and visualize the rnaSeq alignment coverages by GBrowse track. Lastly, query the tables: ApiDB.ProfileElement, ApiDB.Profile, ApiDB.ProfileElementName and ApiDB.ProfileSet, to check if the reasonable number of intensity profiles are loaded. In the case of time series rnaSeq, also check the tables: RAD.AnalysisInput, RAD.AnalysisResultImp, RAD.Anaalysis, RAD.LogicalGroupLink and RAD.LogicalGroup to find out if the the reasonalble number of differentially expressed genes are loaded.

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: The final/ dir must contain the following files: analysisConfig.xml and a FASTQ file for each sample in the experiment. The analysisConfig.xml privides properties for creating expression profiles of all samples in the experiment. The name of FASTQ file must be consistent with "sampleName" defined in "rnaSeqSample". To make analysisConfig.xml, please check the google doc: "Analysis Config Breakdown"

datasetClass.prop: Name of rnaSeq experiment, it should be consistent with "name" defined in "rnaSeqExperiment".
Unique name of samples in rnaSeq experiment. One name per sample, and the name must be consistent with the FASTQ file name under final/ dir.
Name of rnaSeq experiment, it should be consistent with "name" defined in "rnaSeqExperiment".
Unique name of samples in rnaSeq experiment. One name per sample, and the name must be consistent with the FASTQ file name under final/ dir.

[histonemod, tfbinding, mnase, faire, dnase] The type of experiment, controlled vocabulary. All samples in the same experiment MUST be of the same type (e.g. you cannot have some faire and some mnase samples in the same experiment).

The name of the sample in the same experiment which can serve as control for this one, if such a control exists (leave empty if there is no control). If this sample is itself a control, you MUST repeat its sample name here (do not leave empty).
If known, the fragment length. Else, leave empty

datasetClass.purpose: Note: this should include product names for organelles as well

datasetLoader.pluginArgs: --externalDatabaseSpec "%DATASET_NAME%|%DATASET_VERSION%" --inputFile @@dataDir@@/associations.gas --goExtDbRlsName "GO_RSRC" --goEvidenceCodeExtDbRlsName "GO_evidence_codes_RSRC" --seqIdSql "SELECT g.source_id, taf.aa_sequence_id FROM dots.genefeature g, dots.transcript t, dots.translatedAAFeature taf WHERE g.na_feature_id = t.parent_id AND t.na_feature_id = taf.na_feature_id UNION all select t.source_id, taf.aa_sequence_id from dots.transcript t, dots.translatedAAFeature taf where t.na_feature_id = taf.na_feature_id UNION all SELECT taf.source_id, taf.aa_sequence_id FROM dots.translatedAAFeature taf order by SOURCE_ID" --targetTable "DoTS::TranslatedAASequence" --lineOfEvidence "${name}" --inputIdColumn id --tolerateMissingSeqs --skipBadGOTerms @@dataDir@@/badGOTerms.log

--ECMappingFile @@dataDir@@/ec.txt --evidenceCode "${name}" --aaSeqLocusTagMappingSql "select taf.aa_sequence_id from dots.Transcript t, dots.TranslatedAAFeature taf, dots.GeneFeature gf where gf.source_id = ? and gf.na_feature_id = t.parent_id and t.na_feature_id = taf.na_feature_id"

--ECMappingFile @@dataDir@@/${organismAbbrev}LocTagToEC.tab --evidenceCode "Uniprot" --aaSeqLocusTagMappingSql "select taf.aa_sequence_id from dots.Transcript t, dots.TranslatedAAFeature taf, dots.GeneFeature gf where gf.source_id = ? and gf.na_feature_id = t.parent_id and t.na_feature_id = taf.na_feature_id"

datasetLoader.unpack: $currDir=`pwd`; cd @@dataDir@@ ; tar -xzf taxdump.tar.gz ; rm -f taxdump.tar ; cd $currDir

datasetClass.purpose: Gene features that are not provided by the annotation center

Download and load the proteins, to be used in the proteome collection for OrthoMCL, from Uniprot. Files will be processed to obtain the longest protein representative of each gene, to filter out proteins that are less than 10 aa long or that have more than 20 stop codons, and to append the orthomcl abbrev with pipe to the source_id.
datasetClass.prop: The unique 4-letter abbreviation used by OrthoMCL for each organism, will be prepended with a pipe to the source_id, e.g. aaeo|NP_212986.
The ncbi_tax_id for the specific strain, obtained from the NCBI Taxonomy database.
The actual release version designated by Ensembl for this proteome file, e.g. release-71.
List of old orthomcl abbrevs if they differ from the current e.g. 3:pfa, 4:pfa.

datasetClass.purpose: Download and load the proteins, to be used in the proteome collection for OrthoMCL, from Uniprot. Files will be processed to obtain the longest protein representative of each gene, to filter out proteins that are less than 10 aa long or that have more than 20 stop codons, and to append the orthomcl abbrev with pipe to the source_id.
datasetClass.prop: The unique 4-letter abbreviation used by OrthoMCL for each organism, will be prepended with a pipe to the source_id, e.g. aaeo|NP_212986.
The ncbi_tax_id for the specific strain, obtained from the NCBI Taxonomy database.
The actual release version designated by Ensembl for this proteome file, e.g. release-71.
List of old orthomcl abbrevs if they differ from the current e.g. 3:pfa, 4:pfa.

datasetClass.purpose: Download and load the proteins, to be used in the proteome collection for OrthoMCL, from one of the EuPathDB project download directories. Files will be processed to filter out proteins that are less than 10 aa long or that have more than 20 stop codons, and to append the orthomcl abbrev with pipe to the source_id
datasetClass.prop: The ncbi_tax_id for the specific strain, obtained from the NCBI Taxonomy database.
build number for the EuPathDB project
The nanme of this species, as required by the GenesByTaxon search
The unique 4-letter abbreviation used by OrthoMCL for each organism, will be prepended with a pipe to the source_id, e.g. aaeo|NP_212986.
List of old orthomcl abbrevs if they differ from the current e.g. 3:pfa, 4:pfa.

datasetClass.purpose: Download and load the proteins, to be used in the proteome collection for OrthoMCL, from one of the EuPathDB project download directories. Files will be processed to filter out proteins that are less than 10 aa long or that have more than 20 stop codons, and to append the orthomcl abbrev with pipe to the source_id
datasetClass.prop: The ncbi_tax_id for the specific strain, obtained from the NCBI Taxonomy database.
build number for the EuPathDB project

The unique 4-letter abbreviation used by OrthoMCL for each organism, will be prepended with a pipe to the source_id, e.g. aaeo|NP_212986.
List of old orthomcl abbrevs if they differ from the current e.g. 3:pfa, 4:pfa.

datasetClass.purpose: Download and load the proteins, to be used in the proteome collection for OrthoMCL, from the OrthoMCL manualDelivery directory. File defline should have >source_id\sdefinition which may require preprocessing. Files will be processed to filter out proteins that are less than 10 aa long or that have more than 20 stop codons, and to append the orthomcl abbrev with pipe to the source_id
datasetClass.prop: The ncbi_tax_id for the specific strain, obtained from the NCBI Taxonomy database.
Species name with spaces replaced by underscores e.g.
Date or version number of file as it appears in manualDelivery.
The unique 4-letter abbreviation used by OrthoMCL for each organism, will be prepended with a pipe to the source_id, e.g. aaeo|NP_212986.
List of old orthomcl abbrevs if they differ from the current e.g. 3:pfa, 4:pfa.

datasetClass.purpose: Download and load the proteins, to be used in the proteome collection for OrthoMCL, from the OrthoMCL manualDelivery directory. File defline should have >source_id\sdefinition which may require preprocessing. Files will be processed to filter out proteins that are less than 10 aa long or that have more than 20 stop codons, and to append the orthomcl abbrev with pipe to the source_id
datasetClass.prop: The ncbi_tax_id for the specific strain, obtained from the NCBI Taxonomy database.
Species name with spaces replaced by underscores e.g.
Date or version number of file as it appears in manualDelivery.
The unique 4-letter abbreviation used by OrthoMCL for each organism, will be prepended with a pipe to the source_id, e.g. aaeo|NP_212986.
List of old orthomcl abbrevs if they differ from the current e.g. 3:pfa, 4:pfa.
The unique 4-letter abbreviation used by OrthoMCL for each organism, will be prepended with a pipe to the source_id, e.g. aaeo|NP_212986.
The unique 4-letter abbreviation used by OrthoMCL for each organism, will be prepended with a pipe to the source_id, e.g. aaeo|NP_212986.
The unique 4-letter abbreviation used by OrthoMCL for each organism, will be prepended with a pipe to the source_id, e.g. aaeo|NP_212986.
The species name as required by EuPath organism parameter. Use %20 for space characters
The unique 4-letter abbreviation used by OrthoMCL for each organism, will be prepended with a pipe to the source_id, e.g. aaeo|NP_212986.
The species name as required by EuPath organism parameter. Use %20 for space characters

datasetClass.purpose: Retrieve and load the hierarchy of clades file from manual delivery.
datasetClass.prop: Release number which serves as the subdirectory in manual delivery where the clades file is found.
If true samtools rmdup will run after mapping
This workflow calculates coverage in windows across the genome. Default window size is 2500 (bp)
Parameters for Bowtie(2) above and beyond the default can be added verbatim here. "None" if default is ok

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: The final/ dir must contain four files per sample. These should be sampleName.fsa, sampleName.fsa.paired, sampleName.qual, sampleName.qual.paired. Fasta files in final/ should have been trimmed of adaptors and filtered for quality if required. If the reads are not paired-end or quality files are not available, make empty files with the appropriate names

datasetClass.purpose: Add an experiment mapping small non-coding RNAs to the genome
datasetClass.prop: If true samtools rmdup will run after mapping
Parameters for Bowtie(2) above and beyond the default can be added verbatim here. "None" if default is ok
This workflow filters reads by length. Min 20 recommended unless stated by provider
Max 35 recommended unless stated by provider

datasetClass.purpose: Add samples for small non-coding RNA experiments

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: The final/ dir must contain a fastq file for each sample, named sampleName.fastq. Fastq files in final/ should have been trimmed of adaptors and filtered for quality if required

datasetClass.purpose: Add an experiment where reads from samples are mapped to the genome for the purpose of calculating copy number variations at gene and chromosome level
datasetClass.prop: If true samtools rmdup will run after mapping
Parameters for Bowtie(2) above and beyond the default can be added verbatim here. "None" if default is ok
Base ploidy (i.e., ploidy for the majority of chromosomes) in the reference. Use 2 unless you have a good reason not to!

datasetClass.purpose: Add samples for copy number variation experiments

manualGet.descriptionOfFinal: The final/ dir must contain two fastq files for each sample, named sampleName.fastq and sampleName.fastq.paired. Fastq files in final/ should have been trimmed of adaptors and filtered for quality if required. If data is not paired-end, make an empty pairs file with the appropriate name
